snippet: The president has cited an earlier authorization by Congress as a basis for his campaign against ISIS.
abstract: White House believes Congress's 2002 authorization for Iraq War, in addition to 2001 authorization to fight Al Qaeda, provides legal justification for Pres Obama's air campaign against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; disclosure adds to evolving public understanding of Obama administration's theory about basis for strikes against ISIS.
lead_paragraph: The president has cited an earlier authorization by Congress as a basis for his campaign against ISIS.

headline.main: Obama Sees Iraq Resolution as a Legal Basis for Airstrikes, Official Says
headline.print_headline: Obama Sees Iraq Resolution as a Legal Basis for Airstrikes, Official Says

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
